org.jcvi.jillion.trace.sff

Interface SffWriter

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable

    public interface SffWriter
extends Closeable
    SffWriter is an inteface for writing sff encoded files.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Complete writing out the sff file and close the file.
      void write(SffFlowgram flowgram)
      Write the given Flowgram.
      void write(SffReadHeader header, SffReadData data)
      Write out an encoded Flowgram using the data contained in the given SffReadHeader and SffReadData.

    • Method Detail

      • write

        void write(SffFlowgram flowgram)
    throws IOException
        Write the given Flowgram.
        Parameters:
        flowgram - the flowgram to write can not be null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem writing this flowgram to the writer.

      • write

        void write(SffReadHeader header,
           SffReadData data)
    throws IOException
        Write out an encoded Flowgram using the data contained in the given SffReadHeader and SffReadData.
        Parameters:
        header - the SffReadHeader to write can not be null.
        data - the SffReadData to write can not be null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem writing this flowgram to the writer.

      • close

        void close()
    throws IOException
        Complete writing out the sff file and close the file. Users must always close the writer to guarantee that all the sff data has been written. SffWriter implementations may delay writing out all the data to the output until the writer is closed. (For example, certain header information such as the number of reads in the file will not be known until all the records have been written).
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Throws:
        IOException
